OrgName.OrgName_lineage: Eukaryota; Metazoa; Chordata; Craniata; Vertebrata; Euteleostomi; Mammalia; Eutheria; Euarchontoglires; Primates; Haplorrhini; Catarrhini; Hominidae; Homo

Gene-ref.Gene-ref_desc: cyclin-dependent kinase inhibitor 2A (melanoma, p16, inhibits CDK4)

Entrezgene.Entrezgene_summary: This gene generates several transcript variants which differ in their first exons. At least three alternatively spliced variants encoding distinct proteins have been reported, two of which encode structurally related isoforms known to function as inhibitors of CDK4 kinase. The remaining transcript includes an alternate first exon located 20 Kb upstream of the remainder of the gene; this transcript contains an alternate open reading frame (ARF) that specifies a protein which is structurally unrelated to the products of the other variants. This ARF product functions as a stabilizer of the tumor suppressor protein p53 as it can interact with, and sequester, MDM1, a protein responsible for the degradation of p53. In spite of the structural and functional differences, the CDK inhibitor isoforms and the ARF product encoded by this gene, through the regulatory roles of CDK4 and p53 in cell cycle G1 progression, share a common functionality in cell cycle G1 control. This gene is frequently mutated or deleted in a wide variety of tumors, and is known to be an important tumor suppressor gene.

Gene-commentary.Gene-commentary_text: CDKN2A
cyclin-dependent kinase inhibitor 2A (melanoma, p16, inhibits CDK4)

Other-source.Other-source_anchor: cd00204: ANK; ankyrin repeats; ankyrin repeats mediate protein-protein interactions in very diverse families of proteins

Gene-commentary.Gene-commentary_text: Location: 31 - 130 Blast Score: 167

Transcript Variant: This variant (1) contains an alternate open reading frame (ARF), when compared to variant 4. The ARF results from an alternative splicing between a downstream first exon, which contains the translation start codon, and the common second exon. Thus, the protein encoded by this variant (isoform 1) lacks sequence similarity to the protein product of variant 4. Isoform 1 is also called p16INK4a.

Other-source.Other-source_anchor: pfam07392: P19Arf_N; Cyclin-dependent kinase inhibitor 2a p19Arf N-terminus

Gene-commentary.Gene-commentary_text: Location: 45 - 75 Blast Score: 100
Transcript Variant: This variant (4) encodes the longest isoform (4). Isoform 4 is also called p14ARF.

Transcript Variant: This variant (3) contains an alternate open reading frame (ARF), when compared to variant 4. The ARF results from an alternative splicing between a downstream first exon, which contains the translation start codon, and the common second exon. Thus, the protein encoded by this variant (isoform 3) lacks sequence similarity to the protein product of variant 4. This variant is specifically expressed in pancreas.
